Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, top staff!”
Reviews.Author: goldilocks65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights until Monday 16th April 2012. We are in our sixties and seventies respectively and the location of the hotel was fabulous. We were just off Piazza Barberini and just a short walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, particularly, and easy pleasant walking distance to all Rome's major tourist attractions on a nice day (it rained half the time!) The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant, helpful - and humorous! and our room very clean, generous in size and free WiFi (which was great for my iPad!). We also looked out our window onto Via Sistina, which gave us a good flavour and ambience of Rome. Thoroughly enjoyable stay, couldn't have wished for better value for money and contributed hugely to our Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: litalcrespin
Reviews.Content: We staied at the king hotel for 4 night and it was wonderful!! King hotel is not the hilton, it's an old hotel but the room are clean, big, the staf are very nice and always want to help and the breakfast was very nice. The hotel is 5 min walk from the spanish steps, 10 mins walk from fontana dei trevi, you can walk to every attraction by foot, and you can use the Metro that is locted 3 min from the hotel. we had the best time, it was worth the money and we will certainly go back there. Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 2 small blocks away from the Metro station, very central location, easy access to the main hot spots. The staff is very friendly and helpful, they speak many languages. Our room was bigger than we expected, and much bigger than other italian hotels we stayed in that were much pricier. The bathroom was very clean, fresh towels daily, our tub was spotless, and the breakfast crossaints were delicious. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: ValWeitz
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome over the New Years holiday and stayed here for 4 days. Hotel was old and outdated, room was chilly at night with no heating but Rome doesn't really get that cold. Had WIFI because we were on the fifth floor and our room was directly across from the router. The hotel staff for the most part was friendly and helpful, getting us a last minute dinner reservation to a decent well priced restaurant for New Years. Continental breakfast was good and you cant really beat the location. In all I probably would not stay here again. However, considering that we booked our trip three days before New Years it wasn't a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mould, dirt and cold”
Reviews.Author: Paivi P
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome with two other persons, shared a room in hotel King Rome. Our room was cold at nights as the toilet window did not close. The bathroom ceiling was covered by black mould and the room carpet by large stains. The location was good, but why live in a hotel with health risks as there are several hotel nearby?

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ilke Z
Reviews.Content: Great location,easily reached from airport.Airport bus to Termini-metro Line A to Bernini station.And 2 min walking to hotel. Many sites are located near the hotel,so you can go on foot.Trevi foutain,Spanish steps, Villa Borghese.The famous sreet Via Veneto is 2 min away. The room was small,bathroom too,but very clean.Everthing in the room was new. Friendly staff,decent breakfast. I would love to cam again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mary Y
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome. I didn't have any expectations except that I have a clean room, private bathroom, and somewhere to sleep. I was on the first floor near the front that looked out over the street. I have NO COMPLAINTS!! Hotel King met all my expectations and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was perfect and was within walking distance from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Never book this hotel if you want clean modern facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Rcuta2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days and this hotel ruined my great Rome experience. We were stuck on level one, the room was situated at the end of the bar so we had to travel through smOke infested booze bar just to get to the room. Staff refused to confirm our airport transfers via ph and were rude and sly. The lift was torn apart and in bits at the bottom of the stairs but this was "completely safe" the bathroom had a dirty shower curtain which flooded the bathroom and with luggage there was literally no where to stand in the room which had peeling wall paper and mould. Our friends had a slightly better room. Breakfast had no hot breakfast options or even pastries. Service was non existent there. This was so bad my travel agent has black listed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: charles_sidgwick
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Hotel King 7 or 8 times in the past few years. The reasons for going back are value for money, situation and the quality of staff. The hotel has been modernising different parts on an annual basis, and although it may be seen by some as a bit 'old', it's comfortable, clean and welcoming. There's good A/C in every room, and excellent heating in the winter. It's 2 minutes from the Spanish Steps or the Barberini metro stop, less than 10 minutes from Termini, so is very central & accessible. The staff could not be more pleasant or helpful, nothing was a problem for them. That comment extends to porters, kitchen staff and chambermaids, not just front desk staff. I hesitated before reviewing HK, as I don't want everybody to rush there! Seriously, unless you're in the mega rich brecket, you can't do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE!”
Reviews.Author: Carol C
Reviews.Content: AMAZING LOCATION - 5 - 15 MINUTES walking distance to major sightseeing destinations COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN Rooms - airconditioned SPACE - very hard to find an affordable hotel with different areas to "hang out in" BREAKFAST included and available on a lovely terrace - sipping capaccino and listening to the bells of the churches ringing... what a way to start the morning! HELPFUL and FRIENDLY STAFF that spoke english! I can't say enough about our stay at THe KING HOTEL! I was travelling with my 11 year old son and this was the perfect spot for us! The rooms, normal size by Rome standards were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was perfect for both my picky son and for me. We were able to go on our daily adventures by foot and come back to the hotel for a rest before heading out for a nice dinner in the area. My son was able to sit with me in the lounge area, on the comfy couches and watch his movies on my laptop while I enjoyed the view from the balcony and sat back and relax. Rome s a busy place, so to have a quiet area to go to besides the room is a nice touch! This hotel is a great deal for the location alone! 5 mintues from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes to Pantheon, Piazza Navona. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, families and individuals travelling alone. It has something to offer everyone. I would like to thank the staff for a fabulous stay. You will be seeing me again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, needs renovating badly”
Reviews.Author: foodieoma
Reviews.Content: Location is great-5 minutes to Spanish Steps and 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain. We had 3 rooms on 2nd floor. Noise from street is bad. Bathroom had black mold growing between tiles, water did not drain well from tub. Sheets were clean and beds were comfortable. Desk personnel were very unfriendly. Breakfast room was nice and rooftop terrace was nice. Food for breakfast was typical European-ham and cheese, rolls, and boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and great location”
Reviews.Author: cweg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before beginning a Mediterranean Cruise and explored Rome for a few days. It's very old, as would be expected, but the room was adequate. The location was excellent for access to buses and the metro. Our room was located in the back of the hotel and was quiet. Some have balconies. Roof top lounge was a nice place to relax after being out all day. Continental Breakfast was better than most in the US. The men who worked at the desk were most helpful. The bed was hard for out tastes, but we were so tired when we hit them it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the location”
Reviews.Author: RTK1316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several days as a part of an extended Italian holiday. We chose this hotel for the price and the location, just as we did ten years ago when we last stayed here. Not much has changed in ten years. It's still somewhat tired, but we still enjoyed the rooftop patio for breakfast, the overall general cleanliness, and most of all, the location. It's about a 15-minute walk from Termini, but just a five-minute Metro ride (Barberini Station). It's also just a five-minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and maybe ten minutes to Trevi. The Via Veneto is literally out the back door. We were in Room #401, which had a huge walk-out, lush balcony, complete with a cocktail table and chairs, overlooking much of the city. We enjoyed a glass of wine out there just about every night. Surprisingly, we also had a good Wi-fi signal in our room, which made it easy to stay connected. Overall, we believe that this hotel offers good value in a great location, and we'd probably park here again if we get back to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, ideal for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: Wilber4ce
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 1 night on a stopover in Rome. The facilities are basic but clean and the rooms are not enormous but for somewhere to lay your head, this hotel is fine. It's 5mins walk from the top of the Spanish Steps, 15 mins from the Trevi Fountain and is a good spot for a short stroll to pick up the tour bus. There is local, reasonable parking. Breakfast is a cold selection and was fine.

Reviews.Title: “freak out”
Reviews.Author: lappas13
Reviews.Content: it's very dirty, too old, the bath it's miserable, it's too expensive for that it offer, the walls it;s also very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: vijivijayan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Rome. Rooms were small and a little worn but the location was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very simple, cold spread. Overall for the price was very nice, safe and very very convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and what you pay is not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Agustinita80
Reviews.Content: We stood in the hotel for 2 nights, one at the beggining of our trip and the other at the end. Both rooms we got were very disappointing. No lights in the night tables, terribly dirty curtains, old bathrooms with dirty bath curtain. On room 207 wood curtain in one of the windows would not go down. Would not stay there ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravellor86
Reviews.Content: What an amazing position this hotel is in! Walk up the end of the street and you are at the top of the spanish steps, couldnt believe it, was our first trip to Rome and we were so HAPPY! Wonderful staff also, the lady at the front desk was great with any questions, If you get a chance go to the hotel bar at night for a coffee, the man that works there is the nicest man, we ordered coffees and he even gave us a plate of his home made strudel, was lovely. The hotel is very old, it takes two elevators to get to some rooms but we thought it was fantastic to go with the old Rome style. Cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: LilTink13
Reviews.Content: The staff here is incredible. Let me start with that. We felt welcomed from the moment we walked in and everyone was super friendly and happy to serve us with a wealth of information. Our room was super far away. The internet was a bit spotty and that led to some frustrations for planning - in fact, we had to walk about five minutes around the hotel to get to a "good spot." Kind of a bummer... The room we stayed in was a huge disappointment. I've read that some of the rooms were renovated, so perhaps we didn't get a reno'd room? Not sure. Their was mold all over the carpet/walls that caused my husband and I to be stopped up and with sore throats from all the allergies. I then ended up getting sick a couple days later which I have to attribute to this hotel based on timing. The bathroom was grotty, the bed was rickity, and you could hear EVERYTHING through the walls. Our "non-smoking" room had ashtrays all over the place, but thankfully, it didn't reek of smoke at all. The air conditionered worked WONDERS though - that place was cool down in a SECOND and be frigid - perfect for sleeping and snuggling up to your loved one. It was located in an amazing location with perfect walking distance to most of the main attractions. The breakfast in the mornings was pretty decent. I'm giving it three stars because of how incredibly helpful and friendly the staff was. Based on our room... I would say 1-2 stars. Location is definately five stars.

Reviews.Title: “location location, no frills, very good value”
Reviews.Author: macey5
Reviews.Content: just back from rome for the first time for rugby international game.stayed in this very quiet ,nice hotel.location is excellent ,bottom of street and across the road is metro line barberini. 2 stops from termini station (main station). Trevi fountain is on your doorstep literally and a from there maybe 10 min walk to colosseum .cobble stone streets are wonderful in this area..staff i found to be excellent spoke english and the barman flavio is a funguy.very good english also.it was quiet during my stay .self service breakfeast continental style ,again i found to be excellent.i could eat as much as i wanted. (cereal bread jams cheeses ham cofee)tv has a lot of english channels with an easy to use guide supplied.I got a room on 3rd floor which was quite dated and small,but very clean.bed was comfortable and for my view i had rooftops of other buildings but i wasnt in rome to look out the window.toilets are very clean ,again dated ,shower i found was great . electric heating in room that you can adjust yourself.it you want no frills but a great location this is a winner loads of shopping also around.i was a solo travel .i will go back ere and take my parents without any hesitation .advice wear comfortable footwear in rome though!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, caring staff and warm hospitable atmosphere in a highly desirable location!”
Reviews.Author: maryinsf
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of seven - ranging in ages 15 to 84 years - stayed at the Hotel King in December and January and had a blast! We would definitely stay there again. This hotel has a hospitable and caring spirit and all the staff we interacted with were incredibly cordial and accommodating, particularly Flavio the bartender, the porters, front desk personnel, and the friendly and efficient ladies who are the collective motor of the breakfast room. The location can't be beat - you are virtually just steps away from the Spanish Steps, the Keats-Shelley House and the Barberini Metro stop, and within very easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and numerous other sights. I've read many of the Hotel King's reviews on tripadvisor and I think the hotel's been unfairly slammed in many instances. Look, the King Hotel is definitely a budget accommodation, so don't stay in this obvious budget class hotel expecting a five star experience. If that's what you want, please select one of the numerous five star hotels in the neighborhood. However, if you - like me - prefer to economize on the cost of your hotel and put those saved funds to use enjoying Rome, the King Hotel is a great find and offers a terrific deal in a beautiful, historic and highly desirable neighborhood. There is a very attractive and comfortable bar with a big, comfortable sitting area furnished with roomy chairs and several sofas. Flavio, the bar manager, is a wonderful guy, genial and helpful and his little dog Picola is so sweet she's bound to make you smile. As for the actual hotel rooms, they are indeed simple and small, and some of them are, by American standards, run down and a bit dingy, but none of the 5 rooms I saw were dirty. The bedrooms and bathrooms were cleaned every day, towels were replaced and the bathrooms were actually sparkling. We found the breakfast to be abundant and tasty. Guests have a choice of fresh pastries, breads, cereal and milk, ham, cheese, various jams, juice, and strong, excellent coffee. Tea is also available. Considering this is a complimentary breakfast, I think the offerings are generous and quite tasty. And again, I just can't say enough about the awesome staff at the Hotel King, who are truly the heart and soul of what I consider to be a charming little find in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Janjon10
Reviews.Content: We only had a quick visit to Rome and this hotel was conveniently located and comfortable to do all that we wanted to do in a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Look for something else”
Reviews.Author: drdevo00
Reviews.Content: Well we decided to stay here based on location and $. But after staying there, I would not recommend it to anyone. First, they don't tell you that you cannot drive up to the Hotel because "we are in a historical district". Okay now walking with luggage and kids is not my idea of a good time. When we got into the room, there were cobweb everywhere. Then enter the bathroom, enjoyed the pubic hairs in the tube and the mold around the curtain and the bath floor. The "free breakfast", horrible. Bad coffee, no toaster, all COLD!

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: amllkkt5
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i travelled to Rome for a ten day stay and the King was perfect -- didn't expect a top of the line hotel but the staff at the King were really nice and very helpful from the front desk to the breakfast staff to the bartender! the room was basic but all we needed -- the front desk was very helpful giving directions and recommendations -- in the evenings we would go to the hotel bar and meet other guests and talk and the bartender was a doll translating everyone's different languages and keeping everyone happy -- the hotel is in the bast place to see the sights and for shopping we walked everywhere! It was right down the street from the Spanish Steps so it was very convenient to get to anywhere in town. With the high cost of hotel rooms in Rome the King is basic but the staff makes it a great deal

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly Regal”
Reviews.Author: DianeinSFCA
Reviews.Content: Very small room, uncomfortably firm mattress. Miniscule unclean shower. I used my United Miles for four night stay... (paid a couple hundred more) and felt ripped off. Comp breakfast was disappointing. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: Strawb12
Reviews.Content: booked 4 nights stayed the one and couldn't wait to get out. cost me 3 nights accommodation but the upgrade which was not that much more expensive was worth it! Had we stayed it would have put a total damper on our stay. rooms were very old and walls were moldy. bed heads were dirty, carpet very tired and the walls had holes and cracks in them. the systern on the toilet refilled at about 60 decibels!! the only good thing about the King is its location, but there are plenty of other hotels in the same area so spend the extra and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: davidEilat
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Rome after spending 5 days in King hotel. room is very small, and very old looking. The worst thing was the shower which was old,very small, with a shower curtain . The bed was a double not a queen ,and the matress was awful., Breakfast was very poor, coffee was o.k Staff are nice and helpfull, WILL NEVER GO BACK !!!! Great location,

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT HOTEL & STAFF”
Reviews.Author: franslia64
Reviews.Content: Good value for money Hotel. Central can go any were by foot. Very clean beds and towels. Rooms cleaned daily. Very quiet rooms and cofortable bed. Breakfast very good especially the freshly baked croissants. All the staff very helpful, especially the receptionist Signiora Paola.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was alright but could find better for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFoolChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near important landmarks. However, this hotel needs some updating. They use the old method of a key attached to a hockey puck sized plastic piece. They keep the key at the front desk when you are not in the room. The safe in the room is basically a wooden box with a lock used by the same key that is used on the room and remains with the hotel staff. We did not use the safe needless to say, but locked up our luggage. The room had a small TV, and was definitely very basic in general. There was no ironing board in the room. The breakfast was very basic. Some rolls, cold cereal, poundcake, American coffee and juice were the basic offerings. However, the hotel had a nice rooftop area for drinks, food, and at breakfast a lovely covered terrace was available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place. friendly, informal and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Laila1970
Reviews.Content: Small, charming hotel. 500 metres from Scalinata di Spagna (Spanish Steps). Top service, and very helpful staff. Always cleaned room with new towels every day. Nice restaurant/bar with good food. I'm very gladely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - charming, clean & centrally located”
Reviews.Author: julie_wells10
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel on the internet & the first things that attracted us was the cost, the location & the fact that all rooms had air conditioning (we went in August). It was very reasonably priced & included a continental breakfast. The staff were helpful, friendly & polite & the reception staff spoke very good English. The hotel was clean (if a little old fashioned, which added to the charm of the Hotel) & the room cleaned thoroughly every day including fresh bedding. The hotel was perfectly located a few minutes walk from the top of the Spanish steps. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome & will be staying there next time we visit - which hopefully will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly staff but old hotel and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chuck_07_09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights, location is perfect, very near to most of rome's attractions.. you can easily walk to the spanish steps, fontana di trevi, and even the colosseum and the zoo... however we were very dissapointed with the breakfast menu..Do not believe the photos of the breakfast posted on the hotel's website... Breakfast ONLY included bread, (not toasted), some 3 kinds of pastries, cornflakes, tea, coffee and warm juice and water....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, and was probably a nice remodel....30 years ago.”
Reviews.Author: jchipSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the King for four nights with my mother before leaving on a cruise departing Civitavecchia. As many have said, the King has a great location just a couple of blocks from the Spanish Steps and maybe five minutes to the Trevi Fountain. The Bernini metro station is literally at the end of the block and across the piazza. Several restaurants and lots of shops in the neighborhood with some excellent window shopping. Our room was clean and comfortable for our purposes, but anyone expecting luxury and lots of amenities is staying at the wrong hotel! The rooms obviously have not been remodeled in a long time, as the walls, carpeting and curtains show lots of wear. I'm sure our room looked lovely when it was new, the wall coverings looked like silk damask. The beds were comfortable enough, and had a good night's sleep all four nights. The television was modern, but we never could get it to work! Our room was on the 4th (actually 5th) floor, and overlooked the courtyard so was quiet (except for the church bells, but they didn't ring late at night). The breakfast was your typical European continental breakfast each morning, but the pastry was always good and they had great Italian coffee! The staff was very friendly and helpful to us gave us good directions and arranged a car back to Fiumacino to meet the cruise line at a price significantly less than our travel agent arranged from the airport to the hotel. The desk and housekeeping staff always smiled and greeted us as we came and went. Next door was a nice, inexpensive casual restaurant "La Botte". The food was good, reasonably priced, and the service was excellent. Whether or not you like the King Hotel is totally up to your expectations and standards. For us, its location, cleanliness, and helpful staff were most important and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a wimp, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AC405918
Reviews.Content: Great value, superb staff, amazing location! Yes, the rooms are gross. Stained walls, torn curtains, hair in sink. Whatever, I don't travel to spend time in the hotel. Minutes from Spanish steps, metro station nearby. Trevi is also close. I felt very safe traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location, value, atmosphere, and friendliness of staff”
Reviews.Author: aseym23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an absolutely perfect location! Couple hundred meters from both the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It's in the center area next to Barberini Square so easy walking distance to the Coliseum and other major sites. The hotel staff was very friendly and extremely helpful with every question I had - right down to finding a good place to party at night! Every need I had was met promptly and sincerely - everything from finding my way around to assisting me with the tour-guide agency to handling the details of my ride to the airport. Very nice experience staying there. The only thing I could make better was how hot the room was at night. Almost too hot to sleep and the AC didn't seem to work.

Reviews.Title: “2 minutes from the Spanish Steps and the finest view of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: arsmith771
Reviews.Content: Excellent place; friendly, informal and welcoming staff. Two minutes takes you to the top of the Spanish steps and probably the finest view of the Rome skyline to be had from the centre of town. Lovely terrace to have breakfast on!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have choice,go there!”
Reviews.Author: hima2000
Reviews.Content: Entrance & lobby design feels you had made the right choice, this impression later changed when cross the room’s door; we stayed at (306). Like a hell, floor carpet and wallpaper are disgusting, bathroom had very old design, bad accessories amenities, the air conditioning not working, certain areas had been renovate, and breakfast choices are limited but staff keep smiling. It not deserve it value (140Euro/nt).Our "travel agent" had booked us there for 3 days. As a result, we didn't check-out, photo on the web Big different from mine. Hotel is few minutes walk from Spanish steps, many restaurants down street with quality.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST DISCUSTING HOTEL I HAVE EVER SEEN”
Reviews.Author: ccii747
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for three nights, and stayed for one. I spent the remainder of the trip with family outside of Rome and was terrified that I would introduce bed bugs into their home. In walking through the hotel, it appeared as if certain areas had been renovated, which may explain any decent reviews this hotel receives.

Reviews.Title: “Warmest welcome ever”
Reviews.Author: HeppeH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days and two nights in this hotel to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we couldn't have picked a better place. Every single member of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the level of service topped what I've experienced in more expensive hotels in every way. The very sympathetic bartender even took out a few hours of his personal time to show us around some of the less obvious touristic sites in Rome! The location is perfect, with all the major must-see sites easily reacheable on foot. As for the rooms, like another reviewer wrote: "if you want it to be like home, stay at home". No, I would probably not decorate my house the same way as the hotel room, but the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and it was not particularly noisy apart from what you'd expect from a room in the city centre of a big metropolis. All in all, a big thumbs up from us, especially to the staff, who made our stay there more than worthwile. If we ever go back to Rome, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom worked also as freezer”
Reviews.Author: Isomummu
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was nice and tidy, wchich floor was so cold that we could save our foods there. Towels changed every day. The room and bedclothes was from 1950. If you need only sleep and wash youself take this hotel. If you wont to enjoy you staying and if you need internet connection in the room, keep avay from here. Also if you love sweet breakfast this is your place but if you love healthy food this is not for your. Situation is good. Metrostation is rather close (300 meters) and Spanish steps are about a half kilometer from here. The table on the wall told that the price of the room is 200 euros per night. We paid hardly 1/5 of that and it was too much. Personality was very pleasant but however they told lies about internetconnection. I would be accepted all if wlan would have been worked.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Grandmamason
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 301 right next to the elevator which I thought would be noisy, but it wasn't. The beds were comfortable and clean with clean sheets and blanket. The bath was clean and towels were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate, but no fresh fruit. Now, the bad stuff--the carpet was very dirty and the wallpaper which actually was some sort of cloth was dirty, the tv was very small which was o.k.. It was a good location and with some remodeling would really be a nice place to stay. We found a really good restaurant around the corner on Via Dei Cappuccine called Rossini and family type restaurant on Via degli Avignonesi called da Olimpio. I really can't recomment this hotel until they clean it up and remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - I cried, but with laughter!”
Reviews.Author: popjoy
Reviews.Content: I'm British, so in an adverse situation my 'British' sense of humour and the 'Dunkirk Spirit' kick in. This hotel was hilariously bad. Situated bang above a theatre (literally on top of it), in my room I had my own personal auditory rendition of 'CATS' on each night of my two-night stay (a performance from 10.30 till midnight, so I caught the end of it). I lay in bed and shook with laughter. The hotel is dingy and a bit grubby - but on the upside my bathroom and linens and towels were spotless. Breakfast was also okay. Service was efficient. The overall location is good. Actually, reading this I'm wondering if I should give it two dots as 'poor' rather than terrible - because it is cheap. Fact is, it's not the end of the world to stay there if you've been caught out and booked before you've checked Trip (which I did - never again!). However, if you have a choice/are checking in advance - then go someplace else instead. Also, if you are one of those who starts snivelling actual real, snotty, sobbing tears at life's little disappointments - really go somewhere else instead!

Reviews.Title: “Does what you want, near to where you would wish to be.”
Reviews.Author: OldEbor
Reviews.Content: Part of a group which includes the pricey Columbus near Vatican City, but none the worse for that. I have stayed here half a dozen times. Very close to the Metro (Barbarini) and a lot of 'bus routes, but more to the point is within reasonable walking distance of most places (I'm 72 and hardly ever need to use transport). The Pantheon & P. Navona in one direction and the Borghese in the other. It is also about 100 metres from my favourite Rome restaurant - La Fontanella Sistina at no. 150/151 - inexpensive and with an atmosphere you will remember; very fresh fish and vegetables. Hotel prices are fair for location and standard; rooms well large enough and very well cleaned. Staff are pleasant, especially reception where the quality of their English puts my Italian to shame! Breakfasts are of good quality, and for a couple of Euros staff will do a "fry-up". No apparent objection to my making up a roll to take out. There are no evening meals, but see the note about the restaurant above (and Rome has thousands). I shall be there again next February (for the Six Nations Rugby game - Italy v. England) out of choice, because the hotel, the Fontanella restaurant and the location make a 'heady' team.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like this hotel & I won't come back there.”
Reviews.Author: shari09
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is very good, the rooms we stayed in are ugly and poor. The floor was covered with some sort of plastic, the walls were covered with an ugly wall paper. The closet was small, the side tables didn't have any drawers. Unfortunately we booked in advanced before coming to Italy [3 nights at the beginning and one night at the end], so we had to return to Hotel King. This time we got even a worse room. The wall was covered with a smashed wooden panel, and it seemed as if there was once a fire in this room. The wall had a dirty looking color and it was really unpleasant to stay there. The breakfast was also poor - no eggs or vegetables and the bread was hard and dry. When I asked for a key for a safe I had to pay for it. The TV wasn't working either. I guess one has to pay for using it as well. On the whole, it spoiled our stay in Rome. I shall never come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't leave quick enough”
Reviews.Author: mhhoya
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews, I had our concierge in another city call the King ahead of time to specifically request a renovated room, as that seemed to be the ticket to a pleasant stay at the King. Well, if what we had was a renovated room, I would be truly horrified to see an older room. Do not stay here. It is unclean, outdated, and somewhat horrific. All I can in a positive light is its location, which truly cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: tamocrusso
Reviews.Content: If you want a lavish place to stay, this is not the place. However, if you want great value, friendly staff, and a super location, this is just fantastic. We walked to Trevi, the Spanish Steps, great shopping, and the Metro. The continental breakfast was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location beats the small problems”
Reviews.Author: LiinaMaria
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel could not be better; close to the metro station, sights and cheap and good places to eat and do shopping (near Trevi fountain). And still reasonably quiet (though it was a bit difficult to get to the rooms on the 4th and 5th floor). Yes, the rooms are a bit shabby (who cares about that) and there wasn't a minibar in the room as promised, but the (reasonably big) room was clean, it had airconditioning (which in the end was free, even though the leaflet in the room said that there would be an extra charge for it) and comfortable beds and the staff was very nice. We even got a taxi to the airport for 45€. The breakfast wasn't very good (but it was what they promised, continental), however, you could order yoghurt, juice and eggs etc. for an extra charge. Would probably stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: h0lders
Reviews.Content: The location is the only thing this hotel has going for it. The room was very shabby and filthy. There were toe nail clippings on the carpet, which was filthy. There was a lampshade missing from one of the wall lights. The wooden wall panel adjacent to the bathroom was damp as water from the shower had seeped through. The wooden door in the bathroom was filthy and damp and the window had a curtain rail with no curtain. The tiles were all cracked and the grouting was black and the bathroom suite was probably as old as the hotel. There was a balcony with a shutter which wouldn't go up or down - as it was potitioned half up/down, we had to duck under it to get on to the balcony. The furniture on the balcony was very old and was supposed to be white plastic but it was black. There is no chance of getting any sleep before midnight as there is a theatre under the rooms. Loud music sent vibrations through the room every night. It would be impossible to stay here with children. The breakfast was the worst we have ever had at any hotel. A few cereals, bread, jam and tarts. There was no hot food. The doors leading to the balcony did not close properly and we came back one day to find them wide open. There was no lock either. This hotel is an absolute disgrace and to award this hotel with three stars is outrageous. We only stayed here because of a lack of alternative hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: pandi09
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?? Arrived to the hotel and my first impressions were not great as there was a really bad smell as we walked through the doors. When we entered the room I was disgusted and immediately couldnt wait to leave. The room was tiny, our suitcase had to stay on top of the dressing table as there was no ground space for it. The wallpaper was so old and grubby. The head board was black with dirt. The bathroom was also very grubby and infact the shower head was all corroded and rusting. WE thought this was bad until that eveing around 6pm our room began to vibrate with noise. It sounded like a concert was outside the door.... We didnt realise what it was so tried to ignore it. On our return to the room on this night, the music persisted and continued to do so until around 12 midnight. The next evening it began again and we went to reception to ask to be moved. The receptionist was unhelpful and rude. There was a theatre next to the hotel and she refused to change our room. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and would never recommend it to anyone. It is meant to be a 3 star....I wouldnt give it a 1 star recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “King Hotel was better than I expected! Trust me!”
Reviews.Author: Mademoiselle16
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to going and must admit I was more than skeptical but I wanted to be as central as possible and the price was very afforadable for the location so I though I'd take the plunge but I didn't expect anything above average. When I checked into my room, I was really amazed at how clean it was and how comfortable and cosy the room was. The beds especially. Breakfast was very average...just your usual continental. The only thing I'd have to say was reception staff weren't all that friendly. Location was excellent! So close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Via Condotti. I'm very picky with my accomodation but I have to say, it was great and I'd stay there again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: archie001
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that we stayed in. The lobby attendant was unfriendly, rooms were old and dirty. We were 11 in the group and all have the same complaints. Luckily we were able to get an apartment hotel nearby- Resedencia de ripetta. It costs the same as hotel king but definitely better in terms of room space, cleanliness and hospitality of staff. I dont recommend hotel king even if you're in a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: June08Galway
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a wedding. I wasn't sure what it was going to be like after reading some of the reviews. The location was very good, very close to the Spanish steps and once I got my bearings, it was very easy to walk around all the sites. I got a single room which was ok, twin beds ensuite. The ensuite was old and the shower was tiny. The room was ok, not great but fine for a 3 night stay. My parents had a much nicer room with a veranda with table and chairs and a sun lounger and mini bar. My room had none of this. The lay out of the hotel isn't great either, hard with bags. But the staff were very nice and helpful and I enjoyed myself. If you're looking for a place to sleep in Rome that's affordable this is fine but it's not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “dump ditto”
Reviews.Author: gerry8843
Reviews.Content: i must agree with simba in these reviews dirty hotel . The manager put us on a cab to go to the airport cab driver gave the manager some money then the cab took the very long way to the airport $120 for a$40 trip . Sleep at the airport its better gerry

Reviews.Title: “Are there two King Hotels in Rome?????”
Reviews.Author: theroadwelltravelled
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about four weeks before our first ever trip to Rome through the Thomson website, choosing the hotel from a long list, mainly for its location and price, then booked and paid for flights separately. I didn't look on Tripadvisor before booking as the pictures and hotel website looked fine. A few days later I happened to be looking for something else and came across the Tripadvisor reviews! I was absolutely appalled and worried for the rest of the time before leaving. I even tried to cancel but it would have cost a fortune in fees. I'm so glad I didn't cancel - we arrived in pouring rain, the staff were really helpful and the room was clean, comfortable and much bigger than I would have expected for a city centre hotel. We were in 410 which looked out onto the back of the hotel, but at least we weren't facing the busy street, and after all we didn't come to Rome to look out of a hotel window. The location is fantastic, within easy walking distance of Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and close to Metro to reach other tourist sites. We had clean pillowcases on our bed and spotlessly clean towels in the bathroom EVERY day. The breakfast was good - the usual cereal, bread, ham, cheese and spreads but the cakes smelled scrumptious and seemed to be freshly baked each day. Coffee and tea was freely available and the staff would happily make cappucino or espresso if asked. I think the other reviewers must have stayed in a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: schk
Reviews.Content: I should have known better. I read the reviews but after a 3 week trip in Italy, it was the only hotel in town that allowed for a one night stay (I returned to Rome to fly back to the US). I needed the room for less than 24hrs. My room was disgusting. There were black marks on the cloth covered walls from what I assume is years of cigarette smoke. See attached photos. The bed linens looked to be 30+ years old and the bed was saggy. I'm still surprised that I didn't get bed bugs. I should have taken more photos, but took these only to show a friend who recommended the hotel (in truth they said, "it's not great, but it'll do for one night."). I would have rather slept on a park bench. If I had not booked through Expedia (who charges your credit card immediately upon booking and does not give refunds) then I would have walked out after getting the keys. At the start of my trip I stayed several days at Hotel Centrale for which I also provided photos and a positive review. This hotel is not worth 1 star let alone 3 stars. Do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel King is not for Kings!”
Reviews.Author: simba1350
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real dump--it might have been elegant when it was built in 1953, but the furniture in the rooms have not been replaced since that time. The carpet was dirty and matted, the wallpaper is extremely dirty and falling off in some places. The sheets did look clean. It was awful disapointment. It does not deserve any stars!

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: razzy5532
Reviews.Content: fist off lets just say i started kicking myself in the rear for not doing my reserch before booking my room. so 9 months later i finally figured out how to describe my stay (it took me this long to calm down enough to write this review). arrived at the hotel around 6pm and was informed that my room was not ready and would be around 8pm before i could check in. no problem for me i could walk around, grab a bite to eat, go shopping. but the clown working the desk wouldent watch my luggage or let me put it in my room while it was being cleaned or whatever the two hour delay was for. so lets just say i sat in the lobby with my luggage for 3 hours which was 9 pm, my room had to be spotless. when i walked in the bed was not even made up blood stains on the sheets condom wrapers in the trash mold everywhere in the bathroom brown smears in toilet and stains all over the walls and bathroom. ok maybe they forgot to make up my room so i walk down the stairs because the elivator doesent go to my floor and tell the clown behind the counter who i had to wait 15 minutes for him to get off the phone to talk to him. told me there was nothing he could do cuz they were booked so i asked if they could at least change my sheets and clean the room.usually i would have just walked out and found another room somewere else but it was too late i was tired. so he said he could get someone to change my sheets in about 30 min i was ok with that im easy to get along whith at 11 pm i went back down to see the clown and he informed me that there was no one avalable to change my sheets ok i blew it the first thing i wanted to do after 16 hours traveling is sleep my wife was in tears. we finally found the breakfast room at around 1 am which is where we slept thill 5 am when people came to eat breakfast and thought we were 2 bums. went back to our room that morning to get our luggage so we could go get a room somewhere else and half of it was gone. after telling clown number 2 at the front desk what had happend and that someone stole our luggage he informed me that they had a new maid that quit that morning. wow wow wow lets just say it ruined my trip. dont book a room here trust me ive never in my life seen anything that bad . im not a high class person at all ive stayed at alot of motels in my life and never seen one even close to the king.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: tracon
Reviews.Content: ive booked this hotel since recommended from a fellow. to be honest i had a glance on tripadvisor to check the reviews a i was a bit suspicious since each single review was bad. with big surprise i found the hotel very comfortable. it has a great location, very helpful staff, good and rich buffet breakfast. ive been travelling a lot across europe and ive to say this htl has an excellent great value deal! rooms are medium and clean. the only thing was the elevator, but its safe. THOMAS

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay, Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: dsjewell
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the hotel king very enjoyable. The bathroom was clean. The elevator didn't stop at my floor which was a simple matter of taking the elevator and running down some very nice steps to the second floor. I mention this because in my journeys in europe, complicated key card and just big crowded hotels are so much more inconvienent in regards to elevators than just a little side step at the King. The staff was friendly although I didn't have many requests, only where should I eat. They recommended the Tullio, which was wonderful. At request he gave me bottled water and greeted me with a smiling face. The room was a little dingy, who cares? watching the sun rise on the roof and enjoying a good breakfast was all I could ask for. Also the bed was very comfortable. I'd say it derserves its stars.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: PLUSES++++ LOCATION: The hotel actually had a pretty good location not far from the Spanish Step and many great places to eat BREAKFAST: Not bad, the basic stuff you get in most hotels PRICE: One of the cheapest hotels I have stayed in in Europe MINUSES---- ROOMS: While the bathroom was somewhat clean, the actual room was dirty and very dated. Staff: I didn't find the staff to be rude but they were not very friendly either. RECOMMONDATIONS: Do more searching to see what else is available RESTAUTANTS There is a restaurant right next door that is pretty good, I can't remember the name of it. OVERALL I don't think its as bad as some make it out to be. Yes, it is dated and a little dirty but if you are on limited budget and need to be close to the Spanish Steps, go ahead and give it a try. Otherwise, spend a little more and try and find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean And Dirty”
Reviews.Author: fluerLondon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many 3* hotels around europe -but have never experienced such a run down hotel with damp, mismatched bathroom suite every time we turned on the wash hand basin tap - the pipes vibrated and made a loud noise, toilet would not flush, the shower handle was full of milldue the bath looked as if it had not been cleaned and was full of grime ( i'm sure that the enviromental health officer would close down this hotel) The room itself looked very grubby old and dated nothing like it's shown on the hotel's website. When we complained about the condition of the room the reception staff was very rude and arrogant towards us, unwilling to listen to what we had to say, i continued to explain to him that i was not happy and maybe he should come up and view the room. After 15-20mins later he offered to move us to another room - the catch was that it would be the following day. We did change the room to be honest wasn't much better then the last- Basically we spent over £300 to stay in this discusting hotel, and put up with rude staff who have no customer care skills whatsover. We were only there for 3 days i didn't even bother to unpack I felt really depressed - the only thing for us to do was to stay out all day. The only good thing was the location other then that - i have nothing good to say about the hotel condition or the staff. I would rate this hotel as a 1* . So fellow travellers please be careful when booking this hotel it's nothing like how it's shown on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: webms38
Reviews.Content: We were REALLY nervous about staying here after reading the negative reviews. However, in retrospect, I was glad that we did because we were pleasantly surprised. You are paying for the location of the King. It is convenient to everything. We thought the staff was very helpful in bringing extra towels, helping us with luggage and answering all of our questions. Please remember when booking your stay that these buildings are old. They are not newly built Motel6's and they cannot be expected to be in new condition. We stayed in the old part of the hotel and yes it needed updating, but this was not unexpected considering the age of the building. The bath and linens were clean and that is really what mattered most to us along with the ability to walk anywhere in Rome. Our children enjoyed the breakfast buffet with cereal, pasteries and breads. We also bought fresh fruit from local vendors and it was more than adequate for us. If you want a luxury hotel, you are going to pay for it in Rome. If you want a clean room, helpful staff and convenience, then you won't be disappointed by the King. Be sure to bring your own bottled water back to the hotel with you and don't make the same mistake we did in taking the Metro to the Spanish Stairs. You are too far from the King and it is a difficult walk with luggage. It's really important to have realistic expectations for European hotels and the old buildings in which they are located. We stayed in a hotel in Paris during the same week and it was really HORRIBLE. The King was a great improvement. BTW. No more condoms in the baths. Each bath for each of the rooms we booked included extra towels, shampoo and soap.

Reviews.Title: “Staff members are thieves”
Reviews.Author: rozboz
Reviews.Content: We also had a cellphone stolen from our teenaged daughters room while guests at this hotel in June. It was a nice hotel in a great location, the bathroom was wonderful and overall it was a good value. But the theft of property from a guests room is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “auful, dirty”
Reviews.Author: perboe
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dirty, wall and floor. No service at all, rooms are beyond two stairs and two elevators. I exremly expensive for want you get

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lindypc
Reviews.Content: Since I use Trip Advisor for finding some fabulous hotels, I would be remiss in not giving a review for my one night stay. First of all, the hotel is in a wonderful location--between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain; both within walking distance. We went to both of these places at night and felt quite safe. We were with a tour group and happened to be the overflow who did not have rooms in a close hotel. One friend dropped the other hotel because this one advertised free internet. Was he mad when he found out that 'free' meant to walk to a square! Our room was very spartan which I have no problem with. While in Rome, all you need is a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom--who stays in the room? The beds were absolutely horrible. We were over the street and it was very noisy. The bathroom smelled and there was mold between all the tiles. The heat didn't work and we froze but the other people in our group couldn't turn their heat off and they burned up! I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected worse”
Reviews.Author: ikhal
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3-night stay at the King Hotel in Rome I must admit that I was dreading my stay after reading some of the reviews in Tripadvisor, however when I arrived there, I have to admit it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The location of the King is excellent and the staff at the reception were extremely friendly. The lift to the 2nd floor still wasn't working however we were helped with our luggage upon check-in (up to the 3rd, walk down to the 2nd!). We were offered a choice of either a room at the front overlooking Via Sistina or a room at the back where we were warned that there was no view at all. Prefering some quiet we chose the one at the back. Our room was quite large; 2 twin beds and sofa and another bed for our daughter in an adjoining room. The bathroom was a decent size and everything was kept very clean. We did feel that our room could have done with some refurbishing but it wasn't really all that bad on the whole. The one thing that really bothered us was the nasty smell in the bathroom. However we have stayed in worse hotels and as I especially appreciated the friendly staff and excellent location I probably would return to the King when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPayneRochester
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel with a fully paid confirmation from Expedia, on March 15th, 2007 (paid for the room in October). They had absolutely no record of my reservation, said that Expedia was not one of their vendors, and made me pay for the room again. No offer to call Expedia, told me to go find an internet cafe somewhere and figure out what was going on. I had 4 hours to spend in Rome, and wasn't going to waste my time doing this. I've taken it up with Expedia, they have tried 4 times to contact this hotel to fing out "what happened", and the hotel is not getting back to them, after a promise to return a call after 24 hours. Was given a room on the 2nd floor, the elevator to the 2nd floor was not working, had to go up to 3rd floor and walk down. Others chose to schlep their luggage upstairs, finding out the hard way that the 3rd floor was actually up 6-7 long flights of marble stairs. The room was musty, so hot we had to open the windows, the bedspread had holes in it, the lighting was poor, the beds were uncomfortable, and the ceiling in the bathroom was nothing more than slats leading to God knows where. Friends of ours stayed at the ROMA2000 hotel about 2 blocks away, and had a wonderful experience. Do yourself a huge favor, do not stay at the Hotel King. If you do, do NOT book through Expedia. Paying once for this hotel was bad enough, paying twice is a crime. In my opinion, they should have honored my reservation, and taken this issue up with Expedia directly, instead of making me feel like it was my fault, and making me jump through hoops for days to try and get it resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Jules1962
Reviews.Content: My daughter had her mobile phone stolen from the room the last night we stayed there. The room was extremely basic but the sheets were clean. This is all I can say about this hotel apart from that it is in a great location. Try and find somewhere else to stay if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, bad food, great location, got sick”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelin
Reviews.Content: We got there and the hotel was run down. I have been to Rome 12 times and I booked my stay there with short notice so I got stuck here. The room we got was large, but the bathrooms are the smallest I have ever been in. You could do everything you wanted while in the shower. I am not sure how clean the place really is but I started to weaze over the first night there, then I got a cough, and had to take antibiotics because I got something in my lungs. You might be asking well it could have been from something else, but I can guarentee you it wasn't because it happened to my family who were staying in a different room. The staff is very nice, and the location was great, but the price sucked! $225.32 USD per night total. We were there for 3 nights and those were long nights. There are many other hotels I would stay at, but on short notice if you had to, you could stay here. Oh ya, the food isn't good either. It is a 2 min walk to the Spanish steps which I feel is a great location to be in. Try to find a different hotel if you can...(I forgot to take photos of the room probably because I hated it and I didn't want to ruin the camera).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel King, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: praktikalmagic
Reviews.Content: The Hotel King, Rome is a very basic, flat rate, no frills hotel. We had room 202, which was directly next to the lift and every time someone used the lift, you could hear it. The room itself was a triple, the decoration was tired. The bathroom was ok, again very basic, with odd tiles and a cistern that dripped water onto the floor. Overall the hotel was ok considering all we did was sleep, shower and dress there. It is in a good location for the Spanish steps, Via Condotti and isn't far from the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. The male staff on reception we friendly and helpful. The only person I found difficult was a woman receptionist on the day we checked out. She was aggressive and unhelpful. I would definitely return to Rome, but would consider 4* accomodation when going to Italy as it seems to make quite a good deal of difference to the standard of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gabyoc24
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package - 5 days in Paris, 5 days in Rome. The hotel in Paris, while not a luxury hotel, was fine, a solid 3 star hotel. Unfortunately, the King Hotel was not. While the location is great and the breakfast buffet was acceptable, our room was disgusting. The carpet, tile and wallpaper were at least 35 years old. The green carpet was actually black in areas around doorways. The wallpaper was stained everywhere. The tub/shower had black mold which was 2-3 inches wide in the corners. My wife and I have stayed at Motel 6 in the US on certain occasions and have roughed it at a facility in the middle of the Amazon. I must say that any Motel 6 room or our jungle lodging was far more pleasant and sanitary then the room here. We decided to stay here even after we saw the room to avoid wasting a day getting a new hotel, moving etc. Big mistake. My wife's cell phone was taken from our room on the last day of our stay. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: InfTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The location is great (about 10 minutes to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, 2 minutes to Piazza Barberini and metro station), but the hotel is in desperate need of remodeling. I'm not sure why Expedia gives it 3 stars, in my opinion it's a poor 2 star hotel. The only thing clean in this hotel was sheets and towels. The carpet is in awful condition, same for walls and bathroom. I tried to capture the condition in the photos, but it's not really shown, I guess due to flash whitening the surfaces. The staff was friendly (most of them). The breakfast is tolerable if you assume it's free! The street is very busy and we could hear the noise at night even though we were on the 4th floor. It was not bad in September, but I assume if you need to leave the window open overnight the noise can get intolerable. I recommend this hotel if you don't really care about what you get inside and just need a good location and cannot find any other place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ShazC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from long weekend in Rome having stayed at the Hotel King on the Via Sistina. Having read some of the reviews before our trip I was very concerned about the hotel and worried that it would spoil our short break. But I am pleased to say we had a fantastic experience. Despite the comments of some other reviewers, the staff were very friendly from the minute we checked in to the minute we left. The room was exceptionally clean, comfortable, though not luxurious, and provided a perfect base from which to explore this fantastic city. The location is excellent and we loved the fact that we had to pass either the Fontana di Trevi or the Spanish steps every time we went out. We walked everywhere and this would not have been possible from a hotel which was not quite so central. We even had a balcony but made very little use of this as we were out enjoying Rome. So, for those of you who are planning a visit and feeling a little anxious about your choice of hotel - do not worry! The Hotel King is ideal - if you want a hotel with lots of facilities then this is not the best choice but why go to Rome at all if you want to spend time in your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dglboston
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on priceline last year and it was not as bad as some reviewers out to be. It was frustrating though that the elevator was not working and we had to walk up 4 floors which only got fixed on the latter half of our trip. Depends on what you want really..If you are looking for 3 star and above comfort, at least, not the place to be. If you are looking for a decent location, it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you travel to Rome and expect it to be like home, then stay home! But if you are ready to experience Rome, as I did for the first time this Spring, then stay at the Hotel King. The location is wonderful and I thoroughly enjoyed my early morning walks around the neighborhood. The hotel is convenient to every attraction in the city - most by foot, some by taxi and all by the subway. The staff was overly accomadating and couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. We four adults stayed for a week and would definitely go back when we return to Rome -yes we threw our coins in Trevi Fountain! Buon Voyyagio!

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend time in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: theboatmanscall
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it was last updated in 1970. The lounge was dark, its wallpaper peeling and the carpet threadbare. The room was small and dark. The phone was still rotary. The shower in our room was about 2 feet square and the curtain sticks to your body. The shower flooded the first night. What they call breakfast there consists of about 4 different types of cake, "coffee", tea, bread and nutella. We were better off going to a cafe down the street. The location felt fairly central, and it was easy to get to bot the metro station and tour bus stops. We got this room on a package from go-today. I do not recommend their packages because these types of cheap hotels are used in their low price option. You end up spending much more to stay out of a dank hotel like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please see the attached correspondence which has bee sent on a number of occasions to Hotel King. I would welcome your views on this matter and ask if this is a situation which you can accept from a hotel In Rome. Sent: Monday, June 27, 2005 1:34 PM Subject: Recent Stay at your Hotel Attention Chief Executive Dear Sir/Madam, During a recent holiday in Italy my family and I stayed at your Hotel on Via Sistina. We arrive on the of Saturday 11th June and found the female receptionist to be most impolite, arrogant and highly unprofessional. We all had prebooked and prepaid gfor our accomodation and presented our Vouchers to confirm this. We were advised that some of our party had to go to another hotel for which their taxi would be paid. When I question this, the receptionist became arrogant and flew into a raging temper, banging her fists on the table in front of her. When we asked if we could heat a bottle for an eighteen month old child we were told we would have to go a bar down the street. In more than thirty five years of travelling the world and staying in hotels of every size and classification I have never witnessed such behaviour. I cannot accept that your hotel would condone such action. Apart from this incident we found your hotel to be satisfactory, all other staff members could not have been more courtious and helpful. IHowever it might be useful to consider prividing a small microwave unit to facilitate people with small children. I look forward to a satisfactory response from you and hope that I will not have to take this matter any further. Yours sincerely Jim O'Connell

Reviews.Title: “this is a zero star motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got this from bidding at Priceline for a 3-star hotel. Priceline: take this off your list or sacrifice your reputation. After confirming our reservation, I called up the hotel directly to ask for an extra bed and the hotel confirmed it. When we arrived they said they only had a small room which could not fit an extra bed. (Note that they confirmed a 3rd bed months before our booking). Tired and stranded, we said we'll take it but we'd like to see the room first. Upon looking at the room, even if we were so tired, we could not stomach to stay in this kind of hotel. The the other disgruntled customers in this website described it accurately. We cancelled and had to search and bite the steep price of a better quality hotel just to save our holiday. King Hotel should be reported to the Italian govt - it is an embarrassment!

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are buying”
Reviews.Author: tripaholic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the King Hotel in Rome Italy in June of this year. I had read all the complaints about it on TripAdvisor (unfortunately this was after I had paid for the room in advance) I guess this left me feeling anxious and uncomfortable, but-- I guess because I was expecting the worse, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and private -- There were very few amenities (however there were packaged condoms in the bathroom) The location was ideal. It is in walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the shopping is excellent around the Hotel. I would stay there again if only for the low price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient, and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On entering this hotel which I looked for carefully as small entrance we were greeted by a very friendly and helpful receptionist it was lunch time july 5th. His english was very good and he got the porter to take all our luggage to the rooms. Unfortunately the AC was not working but fans were supplied in all the rooms. The roof garden and other terraces were pretty. This is a 3 star hotel and not a 5 star it is very central 5 mins to spanish steps, 7 mins to trevi fountain and 15 by bus to the vatican. The continental breakfast is sufficient but should you need anything else there is seperate menu you can purchase from. The showers are powerful and rooms are changed frequently and no problen to have more towels. It is clean and really a place to sleep, have breakfast and chill out on the terrace in the evening, no restaurant apart from breakfast but the choice around the city is phenomenal. I feel the staff were helpful, friendly and polite and I would definetly go back there if going to Rome again. It is not the laps of luxury but sufficent. Thank you for the lovely time 14 of us had there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had confirmed reservations for a 'superior' room which we had made in March of this year. When we arrived the lady at the reception desk smiled and said there was a problem. They did not have a room for us eventhough we had confirmed reservations, but sent us to another hotel further out. She said we could come back the next day as we were to stay there a total of four nights. We had no choice but to go to the other place. The next day we came back and they told us that because of their mistake we would only be charged 150 Euros instead of 190 Euros. We quickly realized we had a 150 Euro room (only tub no shower) instead of the superior room. We wanted a shower so the next day they moved us to a room with a shower. The stall was about 24 inches; you could hardly turn around in it. The breakfasts were terrible. They had croisants, but you had to ask for them; they seemed to be rationed. The coffee was weak and warm. They had no cheese or deli, only bread, butter, cake and cereal. We had been in Italy for two weeks and this was the worst breakfast we faced. We had stayed at the King a number of years ago, but never again. I would not recommend this 'hotel' to my worse enemy. I only wish there was some authority in Rome I could report them to. The place should be closed or fined for the way they operate.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dickie-7
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the king Rome Hotel we were a bit worried as to what we would find on arrival. Im afraid to say that most of the reviews are correct. The place is pretty shabby, if you look at the photos on their website it looks like they were taken in the 1980's which is probably when it last had a refit. On the plus side we did find the staff very friendly and helpfull and the location is good. Overall i would say that its best to book somewhere else as its way over priced for the standard of hotel you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “The King does not RULE!”
Reviews.Author: sp8holly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was inexpensive for Rome and it showed. Very old, dated rooms with old bathroom but was adequately clean. The beds were skinny and lumpy. Everything looked old and not in an elegant way. I do believe it was a good location (i.e. close to the subway), but I would never stay there again. The bathroom amenities were a bar of soap AND four packages of condoms branded in the hotel name. I thought that was a bit tacky. I felt like the front desk people were jokesters and breakfast was terrible. I was thankful I was there only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, adequate room & facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jim1981
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an enjoyable stay at the Hotel King in Via Sistina, Rome. On arrival we requested an upgrade to a room with balcony. Upon viewing both rooms, this appeared to be a good move as the original room was small, dark and quite dingy. In contrast the room we upgraded to (at no further cost may I add) was bright, spacious, clean and adeqauetely decorated with the added bonus of a morning sun soaked terrace. One point to add is that the room was fairly cold when we arrived and the heater took at least 15 mins to to start working once was switched on. Breakfast was adequate, bread very tough so a tip is to ask for bread to be slightly toasted. Cakes on offer tasted like they had been around for as long at the Colloseoum and the orange juice was nothing special. The Hotel was ideally located 2 mins walk from Barberini Metro Station and 5 mins walk from Piaza De Spagne and the SPanish Steps. For a relaxing drink we would recommend a capuccino sat at an 'al fesco' table at the Amercan Bar on Piazza de barberini. Also try Blue JCE Ice Cream Parlour along from Hotel King on Via Sistina for every flavour of Ice Cream you could possibly imagine. All in all an enjoyable stay and would come recommended.

Reviews.Title: “hotel king was good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel King for 3 nights in June '04.The location is pretty much what you're paying for here, people. We walked to the spanish steps, the trevi fountain, via margutta(sp), piazza del popolo, the pantheon, and the piazza navona, all due to our close proximity!! The hotel has a great outdoor breakfast room, friendly staff/concierge, clean bathroom, but it's not the Ritz-Carlton. So, if you wanna get off and on the subway in less than 5 minutes, and be close to via veneto, piazza barberini, and the other sites mentioned above, the hotel king is a good place to stay. You're in Rome!! concentrate on this awesome city, forget about the hotel and whether it's got one glass or two.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever been. Booked a room with airco, but the so called airco was a portable device that produced more hot air and noise than a hairdryer ! We have received two other airco devices, which were both very bad and only produced hot air, then switched to a room with the same airco device and same problems... The breakfast was NOT good and there was not much variëty in it. We stayed there for two nights in July 2004. This hotel is surely not worth spending that much money.

Reviews.Title: “O MY”
Reviews.Author: smcdNewYork
Reviews.Content: THis really was the pits. The walls the floors, the furniture, for 2 people you would think that they'd give you 2 glasses. Breakfast was good. The area was great, so if you just want to sleep - ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel King not fit for the servants....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a flight attendant, I travel for a living and recognize a crummy hotel when I see one. The Hotel King is definitely that. My husband and I stayed in this property one year ago, the first night we arrived in Italy for our honeymoon. We realized the difference between European hotels and the amenities we are accustomed to in America prior to our trip. However, this property was atrocious! The man at the front desk spoke fairly good English when we checked in. We opened the door to the room and it smelled so awful I almost started crying. I kicked off my shoes and walked across the carpeting only to hear squish, squish, squish. The carpeting was soaked from a window that was left open. The mildewy smell was horrendous. When I phoned the front desk to report the problem, the man acted as if his English was so limited he could not understand. After a lengthy, unpleasant conversation he moved us to a different room. It was not much better. However, we spent one night and promptly checked out to seek better accomodations. Do not waste your money on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Ask about the ice maker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: - The hotel room I was in had a strong air conditioner which was crucial in the summer. - It is near most of the interesting venues and shopping areas Cons: - Room needs renovation. There are mildew stains in the bathroom. - Satellite TV lost the audio feed on CNN after the first day - Window sills are cracked and need repainting - Carpets are stained - Staff is not particularly conscientious about replenishing toilet supplies. - Shower sprays water all over the bathroom. - Shutters do not close perfectly so watch out for peeping toms. - breakfast is minimal: toast, jam, instant coffee, watered down juice, corn flakes, rice crispies, and miscellaneous cakes that really aren't things you should be eating early in the morning - elevator door doesn't close all the way- i'm just waiting for this old clunker to crash thru the basement one of these days - here's something everyone who has the misfortune of staying in this hotel should do just for their amusement: ask them about their ice machine and see how many different answers you get. Here are all the ones I've gotten from the different people who have manned the front desk: - It's being fixed - It will be fixed tonight - You will have ice tomorrow - There is no ice - You can get ice from a local restaurant By the way, there is no ice bucket in the room itself so my guess is, THERE IS NO ICE MAKER IN THE HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Biggest Dump in the World”
Reviews.Author: louropa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the terrible luck to stay at the Hotel King during our rececnt trip to Rome. This place is not worth 1 star, nevermind 3. When we arrived, we were shown to our room. There were holes in the furniture, the walls were burned in some sort of fire and never repaired, the window didn't lock correctly letting many insects in and the bathroom was filthy. My wife asked if there were any other rooms available and the only other one was without air-conditioning. We stayed put one night and were moved for our second night to a better room. (Sadly, we did this through priceline and had already paid for 2 nights - as did many people there - do not use priceline in Rome for a 3 star hotel - you get stuck here) When we were switched to the "better" room the next day, the man at the reception desk rudely told my wife that we would like this room better because it came with "a swimming pool and a tennis court," implying that our desire to stay in a clean, disease-free room was unreasonable. Sadly, I think the room we got was their best room (having seen in many others) and it was still a pit. This place sucks. The people are all rude and unhelpful. The breakfast is bad. The coffee terrible. I would advise anyone to either sleep on the street or go to another city if the only available hotel in Rome is Hotel King. You'd be better off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel in excellent location...about a block from the Spanish Steps and around the corner from a Metro station. For the money, it is a good deal, although it has no air conditioning and the elevator is plastic and creaks as it goes from floor to floor. Also, only room for one or two persons and a suitcase. Breakfast was excellent bakery and included. Overall, I would recommend it but not luxurious if that is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Catswhiskers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Hotel for our honeymoon in 2003 and when I opened the door to the room I burst into tears! It was small and had very dark padded walls. The bathroom was in a bad state of repair but clean all the same. The breakfasts were good (if you like cakes) so no complaints there! I have stayed in lots of budget hotels accross europe and I have to say that this was one of the most expensive and one of the worst... I won't be returning!

HotelInfo.Name: King Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sistina 131, 00187 Rome, Italy
